title: Vermillion
description: A realistic VR oil painting studio with tools, color mixing, and lifelike canvas textures.
educational: Great for art classes to explore painting techniques, color theory, and digital studio practice.
notes: Controllers recommended

title: Open Brush
description: An open-source continuation of Google’s Tilt Brush, allowing 3D brush strokes in space.
educational: Useful for teaching spatial art, VR creativity, and immersive design projects.
notes: Community-supported fork of Tilt Brush

title: Painting VR
description: A hands-on VR painting workshop with large-scale canvases and customizable tools.
educational: Allows students to practice painting techniques without materials or mess.
notes: Room-scale recommended

title: Kingspray Graffiti
description: A VR graffiti simulator with realistic spray paint effects and urban backdrops.
educational: Lets students explore street art safely while discussing art history, culture, and expression.
notes: Comfort turns for classroom use

title: SculptrVR
description: A beginner-friendly VR sculpting and voxel modeling tool for creating 3D objects.
educational: Good for introducing students to 3D design, modeling concepts, and creative prototyping.
notes: Beginner-friendly

title: Gravity Sketch
description: A professional 3D design tool for sketching, modeling, and prototyping in VR.
educational: Excellent for design, architecture, and engineering students to collaborate on 3D projects.
notes: Accounts for cloud features

title: ShapesXR
description: A collaborative VR prototyping tool for UI/UX and spatial design.
educational: Useful in computer science and design programs for testing user interfaces and team collaboration.
notes: Great for team reviews

title: Arkio
description: A VR architectural design and planning tool with real-time collaboration.
educational: Architecture students can model buildings, test layouts, and visualize space in VR.
notes: Hand tracking supported

title: Figmin XR
description: A mixed reality creative app for building, animating, and interacting with 3D art.
educational: Encourages students to blend VR and AR by creating interactive MR projects.
notes: Leverages passthrough MR

title: Nanome
description: A VR interface for visualizing, building, and simulating molecular structures like DNA, proteins, and more.
educational: Excellent for chemistry and biology education, enabling interactive molecular exploration and simulation.
notes: Free basic version; premium features via paid licenses

title: Sharecare YOU: Anatomy
description: A detailed human anatomy explorer with layered systems and guided lessons.
educational: Great for anatomy and physiology to examine organs, systems, and clinical context in 3D.
notes: Standalone app

title: The Body VR: Journey Inside a Cell
description: Travel through the bloodstream and enter a living cell to explore its organelles and functions.
educational: Helps students visualize cell biology, organelle functions, and human anatomy at the microscopic level.
notes: Short, immersive experience (under 30 minutes); moderate comfort level.

title: 3D Organon VR Anatomy
description: A comprehensive medical XR platform with detailed 3D anatomy, ultrasound simulation, quizzes, and Medverse multi-user sessions.
educational: Designed for in-depth anatomical exploration, medical imaging practice, and collaborative learning for students and professionals.
notes: Guest mode is free; full features require subscription (approx. €499.50–€999.50/year).

title: Mission: ISS
description: An immersive simulation of life aboard the International Space Station—learn to dock, spacewalk, and explore using real NASA models and astronaut-led media.
educational: Strong STEM content—ideal for learning about space, robotics, physics, and astronaut workflows.
notes: Free non-profit experience; Emmy-nominated.

title: Titans of Space PLUS
description: A guided, scale-accurate VR tour through the solar system and nearby stars with voice narration, interactive stops, and comfort settings.
educational: Perfect for teaching astronomy and spatial reasoning—includes basic and extended tours, planetary comparisons, and gravity probes.
notes: Comfortable motion mode; optional short (~20 min) or long (~35 min) tour; well-rated by educators.

title: Apollo 11 VR
description: A cinematic VR experience replicating the Apollo 11 mission—ride into orbit, land on the moon, and walk where Neil Armstrong did.
educational: Great for space and history learning—immersive depiction of the first moon landing including real audio and environments.
notes: Linear experience (~1 hr), sitting or standing only.

title: Ocean Rift
description: A peaceful underwater journey exploring marine environments—swim with sharks, dolphins, and prehistoric creatures.
educational: Ideal for biology and marine science—experience diverse ocean ecosystems in VR rich with detail.
notes: Comfortable experience; mixed-reality support on compatible headsets; often on sale (~$6).

title: Blueplanet VR Explore
description: Volumetric VR travel through remarkable natural and cultural scenes—caves, temples, deserts, and more.
educational: Great for geography, art, architecture, and culture classes—immersive field trips with beautiful high-res environments.
notes: Comfortable; offline; includes 40+ scenes in base app.

title: Wander
description: A VR world explorer powered by Street View imagery—visit landmarks and locations from around the globe.
educational: Great for virtual field trips, geography lessons, and cultural studies, enabling place-based learning in the classroom.
notes: Requires internet connection; Street View-style navigation.

title: Mondly: Languages in VR
description: A VR language learning app with conversational practice, speech recognition, and immersive scenarios.
educational: Supports ESL and world languages by giving students an interactive way to practice speaking and listening in context.
notes: Free to download; subscription required for full lessons; headset microphone needed.

title: Immerse — Learn Languages in VR
description: Live instructor-led language sessions with conversation practice and interactive environments.
educational: Supports conversational fluency, cultural exchange, and role-play activities for language courses.
notes: Subscription required; headset microphone recommended.

title: ENGAGE XR
description: A multi-disciplinary virtual events and education platform for classes, conferences, and interactive sessions.
educational: Useful for remote lectures, guest speakers, virtual classrooms, and cross-departmental projects.
notes: Free with premium tiers for advanced features; enterprise options available.

title: Spatial
description: A social VR platform for exhibits, galleries, and community events.
educational: Students and faculty can host showcases, poster sessions, and interactive cultural spaces.
notes: Requires free account; supports multiplayer collaboration.

title: Immersed
description: A VR productivity workspace with multiple virtual monitors, shared team rooms, and customizable focus spaces.
educational: Great for focused study sessions, research, and remote group work across departments.
notes: Free with optional premium plans; account required.

title: TRIPP
description: Guided mindfulness and meditation experiences with calming visuals, music, and breathwork prompts.
educational: Supports student well-being, stress management, and mental health initiatives on campus.
notes: Subscription required after free trial; seated recommended.
content_notes: Visual patterns may be intense for sensitive users.

title: Energy Encyclopedia VR
description: An interactive VR exhibit of global energy systems—explore cross-sections of nuclear, hydro, wind, fusion, and solar power plants.
educational: Ideal for STEM and engineering courses—compare generation methods, safety, and environmental impact in detail.
notes: Free on Quest; consider preloading assets for class use.

title: Ovation
description: A VR public speaking trainer where you present to realistic AI audiences and receive detailed feedback on delivery.
educational: Excellent for speech, communications, and business courses—practice interviews, presentations, and Q&A in realistic settings.
notes: Headset mic recommended; subscription features available.

title: Wooorld
description: A mixed reality 3D world map with real-world terrain, cities, and multiplayer exploration.
educational: Great for virtual field trips, cultural geography, and group learning in MR—students can explore cities, landmarks, and natural features together.
notes: Requires internet; supports multiplayer sessions.

title: Human Anatomy VR
description: A comprehensive VR anatomy atlas featuring detailed 3D models, Ant Mode miniaturization, muscle animations, quizzes, and collaborative tools. Trusted in universities worldwide for immersive anatomy education.
educational: Great for personal self-study or classroom instruction. Provides deep anatomical exploration and interactive tools for medical, biology, and healthcare education.
notes: Two versions available — personal edition as a one-time purchase (~$29.99) and institutional edition requiring licensing with additional classroom features.

title: AnatomyXR
description: An immersive 3D human anatomy experience—students can isolate systems, use explode view, and interact via hand tracking or controllers.
educational: Perfect for anatomy classes, medical education, and self-directed learning with highly interactive models.
notes: Free on Quest Store; requires internet; supports hand tracking and controllers.

title: Cosmic XR - Space In Your Room
description: A mixed-reality space atlas that brings the solar system, galaxies, and black holes into your room using natural hand interactions.
educational: Excellent for astronomy and Earth science—demonstrates scale, motion, and planet comparisons in an interactive MR format.
notes: Supports hand tracking and passthrough MR; requires open floor space for in-room exploration.

title: Bodyswaps - Soft Skills Training
description: AI-powered VR simulations where learners practice communication, interviews, leadership, and empathy scenarios with detailed feedback.
educational: Useful for communications, career prep, and healthcare training—lets students role-play and reflect with personalized AI coaching.
notes: Institutional subscription required; free demo available; internet needed.

title: IMMERROCK
description: A mixed-reality guitar trainer that overlays chords, tabs, and practice guidance onto your real instrument with real-time accuracy feedback.
educational: Great for applied music courses—supports practice of chords, scales, and rhythm with structured MR lessons.
notes: Requires a real guitar; passthrough MR with on-device note detection.
content_notes: Standing required; best with guitar strap.

title: Warship Mars
description: Dive to the 1564 wreck of the Swedish warship Mars, recreated with photogrammetry. Explore underwater, document finds, and analyze artifacts in a virtual research space.
educational: Excellent for history and archaeology units—virtual fieldwork, evidence collection, and discussions on maritime technology and preservation.
notes: Free on Quest; includes Diving and Researcher modes.
content_notes: Underwater diving may cause discomfort for some users.

title: Titanic VR
description: Explore the wreck of the RMS Titanic through immersive dives, ROV missions, and cinematic historical sequences.
educational: Great for discussing evidence collection, maritime history, and ethics of preservation through interactive exploration.
notes: Single-player; includes story content and free exploration missions (~6+ hours total).
content_notes: Disaster theme may be distressing for some learners.

title: Geo Voyage
description: A mixed reality globe for exploring places—drop pins and transition from MR map into immersive VR views with AI-guided exploration.
educational: Great for geography and social sciences—supports virtual field trips, place-based inquiry, and AI-assisted research prompts.
notes: Requires internet; integrates Google Maps and Meta Spatial SDK features.

title: MLK: Now is the Time
description: An immersive VR interpretation of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s “I Have a Dream” speech, blending historic audio with present-day perspectives.
educational: Useful for civil rights and U.S. history courses—connects 1963 to today, prompting reflection and discussion on equity.
notes: Free on Quest; includes sensitive social topics—plan guided debriefing.

title: JFK Memento: The Immersive Documentary
description: An immersive VR documentary exploring November 22, 1963—the JFK assassination—through archival film, photos, and narration.
educational: Valuable for U.S. history and civics—analyze primary sources and reflect on media presentation of historical events.
notes: Previously released as “Inside History: The JFK Assassination” (by TARGO).

title: Notes on Blindness
description: A VR documentary based on the audio diaries of John Hull, exploring the experience of blindness through sound-rich, abstract environments.
educational: Supports discussions in disability studies, empathy building, and humanities by immersing students in sensory storytelling.
notes: Audio-heavy experience; best used with quality headphones.
content_notes: Themes of disability and personal reflection.

title: Rome
description: A cinematic VR journey that explores the history and architecture of ancient Rome through immersive visuals and narration.
educational: Useful for history and classics courses—introduces Roman culture, architecture, and storytelling through cinematic VR.
notes: Short linear VR film experience; best suited for classroom demonstrations.

title: Alcohol and Your Brain: A Rollercoaster Ride Through Your Brain
description: An educational VR experience that takes learners on a rollercoaster-style ride through the human brain to show the effects of alcohol on neural pathways.
educational: Useful for health and biology courses—demonstrates neuroscience concepts and substance impacts in an engaging way.
notes: Fast-paced rollercoaster simulation; may trigger motion sickness in sensitive users.

title: Noun Town: Language Learning
description: A gamified VR language learning platform where learners practice vocabulary and phrases in an interactive virtual town.
educational: Supports ESL and world languages by engaging students in active practice through contextual VR settings.
notes: Paid app; offers multiple languages; supports gamified learning.

title: InViewer
description: A VR utility for viewing 3D content, images, and immersive media in a virtual environment.
educational: Useful for classrooms and projects that involve inspecting 3D objects or visual assets directly in VR.
notes: Supports a wide range of 3D/360° content formats.
